title: How to Change the Year on Google Maps with Google Earth Pro

steps.title: Download Google Earth Pro on your computer.
steps.content: Download Google Earth Pro on your computer. You can only go back in time using this program. [1] X Research source This feature is no longer available on Google Maps . You can download Google Earth Pro on your Windows, Mac, or Linux computer for free. Do the following: Go to https://www.google.com/earth/about/versions/#download-pro in a web browser. Click Accept & Download . Install the setup.exe file. Launch Google Earth Pro.

steps.title: Enter a location.
steps.content: Enter a location. Use the search bar in the top right corner to enter a city, address, or coordinates. Click search . If needed, you can click and drag your cursor to move the camera. You can also zoom in/out by using the scroll wheel on your mouse (or by pinching your trackpad).

steps.title: Click the year next to the clock icon.
steps.content: Click the year next to the clock icon. This is in the bottom-left corner. The clock will have a green arrow going counter-clockwise. A new navigation menu will open at the top.

steps.title: View the map over the years.
steps.content: View the map over the years. You'll see a navigation menu at the top-left corner. To skip to the next recorded year, click the right-skip button. To skip to the last recorded year, click the left-skip button. You can also click and drag the slider to scrub through the years.
